_header: O thou my soul give laud unto the Lord
_description: John Lydgate, paraphrase of Psalm 102 — twenty-two 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc) with Latin text of Psalm preceding each stanza

CamTCC600.First Lines:
O þowe my soule gif laude vn to þe lordBlesse him and
                    preyse and forgete him noughtAlle myne entraylles beoþe in deede and
                    wordAnd al þat euer is in myn Inward thought…
CamTCC600.Last Lines:
…Enseele oure qwytaunce with þy RedempcionWhane þou
                    shalt deeme vs stondyng afore þy face
CamTCC600.Attributed Title:
A deuoute salme of þe sautier which Lydegate daun Iohn translated in
                    þe Chapell at Wyndesore at þe request of þe dean whyles þe
                    Kyng was at evensonge (p. 165); Benedic anima mea domino by
                    Lidegate(RT)

BLAdd34360.First Lines:
[O?] thow my soule gif laude vnto the lordBlisse hym and preyse and
                    forgete hym nought… [f. 53v)
Al sodainly and nowhile abydeIn this world here nomore knowe his
                    place… [f. 56v)
BLAdd34360.Last Lines:
…To have mercy on oure wrecchidnesseThe spirit of man shal
                    sone from hym passe [f. 55]
…And late thy mercy bien oure protecciounffor other
                    saufconduyt have I non forme [f. 57]
BLAdd34360.Attributed Title:
Takith goode heede sirs and Dames howe lyd / gate Daun Iohn the Monk of
                    Bury moeued / of Deuocioun hath translated the psalme / Benedic Anima mea
                        domino (f. 153v)
BLAdd34360.Editions:
Mahir,  Otto,
                        ed.  
             Eine religiöse Gedichte John Lydgates.
         Oberviechtach: Adolf Mahir, 1910: 20-9.

BLHar2251.First Lines:
O thow my soule gyf lawde vnto the lordBlesse hym and preyse and
                    forgete hym nought…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…Enseale oure quytaunce with thy redempciounWhan thow shalt
                    deme vs stondyng afore thy face
